headshotImage.longCaption: Lahiru Kumara player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Reeza Hendricks b Kumara 102 (89b 8x4 1x6) SR: 114.6

dismissalComment.html: and then he's beaten by an absolute ripper. Where were you all along, Lahiru Kumara? Back of a length, jags back in sharply from just outside off, beats the inside edge of his attempted defensive push - his feet went nowhere because the length was just perfect - and it just about flicked the top of the leg bail

headshotImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c de Silva b NLTC Perera
dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c de Silva b NLTC Perera 92 (70b 8x4 4x6) SR: 131.42

dismissalComment.html: full outside off, and Duminy misses out on a hundred. A splendid innings comes to an end, as he steps across his stumps and looks to swing this over the leg side. May have wanted to go a little squarer, but it was a slightly off-pace ball from Thisara, and he ends up hitting it straight down the throat of deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: NLTC Perera headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: NLTC Perera headshot

headshotImage.caption: HM Amla headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HM Amla headshot

dismissalComment.html: gets him next ball! Deceived by the offcutter once again. Same delivery as the last ball, and Amla tries to drive straight on this occasion. But the ball, it jags in sharply, goes between bat and pad, and clips then the top of off stump as Sri Lanka roar with delight. What a delivery. Completely owns Amla. Goes for a well-made half-century at a strike-rate of 100.

headshotImage.caption: F du Plessis headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: F du Plessis headshot

dismissalComment.html: holes out! Back of a length on off, and too short for Faf to attempt to whip off his pads. But he does so anyway, and it comes off the bat's inside half. In the air for a while, and Lakmal at deep midwicket makes no mistake

headshotImage.caption: DA Miller headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DA Miller headshot

dismissalComment.html: low full-toss on off stump, and Miller picks out deep midwicket. Clears his front leg, but can't get the leverage to get the elevation he wants. Dhananjaya takes a good catch, moving backwards, at just around head height

headshotImage.caption: Q de Kock headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Q de Kock headshot

dismissalComment.html: gone! De Kock has looked uneasy so far, and he gets out to a poor shot. A good length ball slanting across him. It's around the line of off stump when he meets it, looking to hit it against the angle over mid-on. Ends up getting a big edge on it, and man at backward point takes the high catch, backtracking and running to his right

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva c de Kock b Phehlukwayo 84 (66b 8x4 3x6) SR: 127.27

dismissalComment.html: good length outside off, but the attempted slog to the leg side does't come off. QdK holds on to it as the bowler appeals for a catch. Umpire Llong says no, but QdK is convinced. They review. Is that out? Looks like the ball went under his bat, and there's a thick under edge on UltraEdge. Oh dear, a beautiful innings comes to an end as South Africa go closer to a 3-0 lead

dismissalText.commentary: Akila Dananjaya c Ngidi b Phehlukwayo 37 (42b 4x4 0x6) SR: 88.09

dismissalComment.html: back of a length outside off, and he tries to flat-bat it over the bowler's head. Off the bat's toe end, and mid off makes no mistake! The momentum shifts heavily towards the visitors once again

headshotImage.caption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lungi Ngidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: straight to short cover! Faf makes no mistake. Full on off, and the drive pops into the infielder's hands. A couple of feet on either side and that would've been a boundary

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: soft! Off the bat's top half and Sri Lanka have now lost both openers. Short ball on middle, and the pull goes straight to square leg. Easiest of catches as Tharanga checks his bat's face on the way back to the pavillion

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: short again, this one's banged in harder and rises over shoulder-high. Mendis goes for the pull again, and has to drag it from outside off as well. Can't keep it down, and Mulder takes an excellent low catch running in from the square-leg boundary. End of a promising innings

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: is this it? Bowler and keeping converging, but Ngidi takes the catch! Slices this in the air and South Africa win by 78 runs!

headshotImage.caption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andile Phelukwayo player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: slow finger of death! But Perera wants to review. Has a chat with his partner, and asks for it. Was a length ball outside off, but angling into his pads, and hitting him on the back leg in front of middle stump. What does the replay say? It says 'umpire's call' with the ball clipping the top of leg stump. The decision stands, and Perera must go back!

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews lbw b Shamsi 32 (42b 3x4 1x6) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: big appeal for lbw as Mathews misses the sweep. Given out, but it seemed like it might have been going down leg. Mathews turns and begins walking back before realising he can review this... Finally decides to take the review. No bat on it, let's see what ball-tracking says... pitches on about middle stump, and it's turning just enough to clip the outside of leg stump. Umpire's call, and that means Mathews will have to walk back

commentPreTextItems.html: Stoffels: "Even though Sri Lanka have improved in their batting, I still feel this is at least a 300 par wicket!" -- Yes, it's a true surface

commentTextItems.html: is this it? Bowler and keeping converging, but Ngidi takes the catch! Slices this in the air and South Africa win by 78 runs!

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.11pm That's all from us at Pallekele. The visitors make it 3-0, and it's also time to say goodbye at ESPNcricinfo. Hope you enjoyed our coverage. See you for the fourth ODI. Till then, adios!

Faf du Plessis, the winning captain: "Brilliant today. Once again, the batting was fantastic. We played aggressive. And obviously, for a debutant to play that freely was great to see. Every game there's one or two guys putting their hands up. Today was less spin and a good one-day wicket. Was nice to see even our bowlers getting a bit of pressure but coming out on top. We just keep taking wickets and that's a great way to plug the run flow. The plan is to test the bench strength now that the series is over. It was good to see Reeza do well in a crunch game. Let's see how I pull up tomorrow, and then decide whether I'll play the fourth game."

Angelo Mathews, the losing captain: "360 to chase was too much. Our execution with the ball was poor, but this is the brand of cricket we want to play. Want to play positive cricket. But a bunch of positives today: Dhananjaya batted well, some bowlers bowled well. But credit to Reeza and Duminy. We need to think out of the box if we need to win away. I know we aren't doing well, but we need to play on good wickets to develop. We're playing for pride, and we want to finish the series off well."

Reeza Hendricks is the Man of the Match: "This is lot different than T20I cricket, and happy to contribute. The wicket was pretty good, and the total made it fairly difficult for Sri Lanka. I didn't know I was the fastest debutant to get an ODI hundred."

Lungi Ngidi: We saw our batsman bat well, so we knew it'll be high scoring. I expected the ball to grip a bit more, but it didn't. I think it was similar to South African surfaces, but if you bowl well you'll earn some bounce. The main chat has been to play positively and look for ways to pick wickets. And with a total like 360, we knew we didn't have to necessarily defend too much. A good return after losing the Test series.

wap36: "Though a SA fan, I am really happy about the positive attitude shown by the SL batting line up and making this a match. Specially at 6/155, there was no "give-up" attitude by De Silva and Dananjaya. "
Sandaru Herath: "Here is something for the sri lankan fans to cheer about Sl u19 beat Ind u19 by 7 runs and lead the 3 match series 2-1"
Buddika: "Mathews did two things right today; calling the toss and telling that his men could chase 270"

5.51pm That's the series for South Africa, as they take an unassailable 3-0 lead. It was always going to be a difficult chase, but Sri Lanka have themselves to blame for that. Poor bowling from the hosts, combined by some very thoughtful batting by the visitors, took them to 363, which was just too much for a fragile Sri Lankan line-up. There was hope, of course, when Dhananjaya and Dananjaya kept the scoreboard ticking, but when those wickets fell in a heap, it was one-way traffic thereafter. Mathews and Faf have a chat in the dressing room, while the rest of the players shake on the ground. Lungi Ngidi shined with his four-for, but even Andile Phehlukwayo was impressive with his three-for.

dismissalComment.html: gets him next ball! Deceived by the offcutter once again. Same delivery as the last ball, and Amla tries to drive straight on this occasion. But the ball, it jags in sharply, goes between bat and pad, and clips then the top of off stump as Sri Lanka roar with delight. What a delivery. Completely owns Amla. Goes for a well-made half-century at a strike-rate of 100.

stories.seoTitle: Getting dropped is part of playing for Sri Lanka - Dhananjaya de Silva
stories.summary: Dhananjaya de Silva has been shunted around the Sri Lanka batting line-up a fair bit, but for now, he seems to have found a place in the lower-middle order

stories.title: South Africa ride on Hendricks ton, Duminy 92 to seal series
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: South Africa ride on Hendricks ton, Duminy 92 to seal series
stories.summary: The visitors sealed a second successive ODI series win in Sri Lanka and 11th consecutive victory over their opponents, dating back to July 2014, after scoring the highest total on the island
